Library Account


  1. Spring Forward to the Library!
    Longer days and warmer weather are inspiring reminders that spring is around the corner!  What a great time to check out books, magazines, and videos to help inform and inspire you to clean and organize your home, plan an outdoor garden or living space, or take up a new hobby! Come check out a pass to visit one of the many museums around the area, or even to take a walk around World’s End! There’s so much to do at the Library…join a book club, attend a craft or movie night, listen to a classical guitar concert, bring your children to a story time, attend a lecture or author talk…discover something new this season!

  1. News & Events

News

  1. Social Worker Cheryl West holds free drop-in office hours at the Library

    Cheryl West, Social Worker for the Town of Hingham, is now part of the Health Department Team and provides support for residents and improved access to resources. She offers free drop-in office hours at the Library on Tuesdays from 10:00 - Noon. Read on...

  2. Memoir Writing

    If you are interested in memoir writing or have already begun doing so, we would love to have you join the group. The class will meet twice per month, April 10 & 24, May 15 & 22, and June 5 & 19 at 1:00. Space is limited, please register. Read on...

  3. Afternoon with the Author: Eamon Earls Discusses the Geologic History of Hingham

    Saturday, April 20 at 2:00 -- Join us for this fascinating lectures as Eamon Earls tells the two billion year story of how Hingham came to be. Read on...
